clinical_study.brief_title: A Study to Evaluate the Safety, Pharmacokinetics and Preliminary Efficacy of PRF110 in Bunionectomy Surgery
clinical_study.official_title: A Single-Dose, Open-Label, Multi-Center Study to Evaluate the Safety, Pharmacokinetics and Preliminary Efficacy of PRF110 in Bunionectomy Surgery

brief_summary.textblock: PRF110 is new extended release oily solution formulation of ropivacaine that is intended for local infiltration into surgical wounds. The purpose of this study is to determine the safety and early efficacy of PRF110 in bunionectomy surgery, to measure the pharmacokinetic profile of PRF110 over 72 hours and evaluate the duration of analgesia witnessed in the surgical setting.

detailed_description.textblock: PRF110 is new extended release oily solution formulation of ropivacaine that is intended for local infiltration into surgical wounds. The formulation is designed to slowly release the ropivacaine over 36-72 hours. By providing local analgesia over a long time span, the need for systemic analgesics is expected to be reduced. The purpose of this study is to determine the safety and early efficacy of PRF110 in bunionectomy surgery, to measure the pharmacokinetic profile of PRF110 over 72 hours and evaluate the duration of analgesia witnessed in the surgical setting.

primary_outcome.measure: Incidence of treatment emergent adverse events
primary_outcome.description: All adverse events (AE) reported by the subjects will be recorded throughout the trial period

secondary_outcome.measure: Total amount of rescue medication used during the study
secondary_outcome.description: Total amount of rescue medication used during the study
Pain intensity which will be recorded at rest at Hours 1, 2, 4, 6, 8, 10, 12, 18 (optional) 24, 28, 32, 36, 48, 52, 56, 60 and 72.
Subject global assessment which will be recorded at Hours 24, 48 and 72.

other_outcome.description: Samples will be collected at designated times up to 72hrs post drug application
